resources.string: the best solution for your privacy
Checking if root status is available…
You can use InviZible Pro with local VPN mode, apps with their own proxy, or a local VPN feature in proxy mode.
You can use InviZible Pro with apps that have their own proxy, or a local VPN feature in proxy mode.
Start DNSCrypt Along With the Device
Start Tor Along With the Device
Start I2P Along With the Device
Amount of seconds to delay auto-start if it doesn\'t work at first.
List of websites to open with Tor. (Does not work for websites behind CDNs.)
List of apps to use with Tor.
List of apps to use with InviZible.
List of websites to open directly. (Does not work for websites behind CDNs.)
List of apps to open directly.
Amount of hours between refreshing website IPs (for Android 5.1 and above). Use \"0\" to prevent it.
An indirect way to connect to the Tor network.
Please turn off \"Entry Nodes\" in the Tor settings, if you want to use bridges.
Please turn off the bridge first!
Use new default Tor bridges now?
Please enter the characters from the image
Do not use Tor for LAN destinations and IANA reserved IP blocks.
Check for new versions of InviZible Pro and modules daily.
Check if new versions are available now.
Only use Tor to download new versions
Look for new versions only with Tor and when Tor is running.
Use root status to run DNSCrypt, Tor, and I2P modules. Using this feature leaves modules unmanaged and may cause connection problems!
Deny HTTP connection over port 80 for HOTSPOT.
Protect the app with \"No Root Mode\" to prevent the app being killed by Android.
Detect Man-in-the-middle ARP spoofing and rogue DHCP attacks in Wi-Fi networks.
All connections to the Internet will be blocked when an attack is detected.
Block a website when a DNS-rebinding attack is detected.
Only connect through the SOCKS5 proxy.
Apply new rules when connectivity changes.
Additional protection with \"No Root Mode\" to prevent the app being killed by Android. May drain battery.
For custom ROMs where pressing \"Start\" drops the connection.

Use the following command to manage app modules: \"am broadcast -a pan.alexander.tordnscrypt.SHELL_SCRIPT_CONTROL --ei dnscrypt 1 --ei tor 1 --ei i2p 1 -n %s/.BootCompleteReceiver\". Where 1 — starts, 0 — stops the module.
Please exclude InviZible Pro from Android battery optimisation. Otherwise Android can kill DNSCrypt, Tor, or I2P at any time. On special systems, (like MIUI) some additional steps are required.
Start Tethering Along With the Device
Route all incoming traffic through Tor.
List of websites to open with Tor for HOTSPOT.
List of websites to open directly for HOTSPOT.
TTL will be fixed to 64 using a local VPN. Kernel support is not required. It can only be used in \"Root Mode\" with the \"Run Modules With Root\" off. To fix TTL, please start DNSCrypt or/and Tor.
Turn on \"Fix TTL\" and set up a LAN device to connect to InviZible. Use the default gateway: %s, DNS server: %s.
Support for Dual Apps, MIUI, Island, Shelter and work-profile apps.
DNSCrypt, Tor, I2P are protected. Don\'t hide.
Require servers (from static and remote sources) to satisfy specific properties.
Use servers implementing the DNSCrypt protocol.
Use servers implementing the DNS-over-HTTPS protocol.
Require servers defined by remote sources to satisfy specific properties.
Servers can not log user queries (declarative).
Servers must not enforce their own blacklists (for parental control, ad blocking…).
Always use TCP to connect to upstream servers.

Useful if you need to route everything through Tor.\n Otherwise, leave this to \"false\", as it doesn\'t improve security (dnscrypt-proxy will always encrypt everything even when using UDP), and can only increase latency. Do not turn this on if you want to use Tor .onion-sites!
Route all TCP connections to a local Tor node. Tor doesn\'t support UDP, so turn on \"Force TCP\" as well.

Bootstrap resolver. This is a normal, non-encrypted DNS resolver, only to be used for one-shot queries when retrieving the initial list of resolvers, and only if the system DNS doesn\'t work. It will never be used if lists have already been cached.
Never let dnscrypt-proxy try to use the system DNS settings. Unconditionally use the fallback resolver.
Route queries for specific domains to a dedicated set of servers.
Import a file of forwarding rules. You can select multiple files. Duplicated lines will be removed.
Cloaking returns a predefined address for a specific name.\n In addition to acting as a HOSTS file, it can also return the IP address of a different name.\nIt will also do CNAME flattening.
Import a file of cloaking rules. You can select multiple files. Duplicated lines will be removed.
Log client queries to a file.
Do not log these query types, to reduce verbosity. Keep empty to log everything.
Log all queries for non-existent zones.\n These queries can reveal the presence of malware, broken/obsolete apps, and devices signaling their presence to third parties.
Blacklists have one pattern per line.
Import a domain list or hostfile. You can select multiple files. Duplicated lines will be removed.
IP Blacklists have one pattern per line.
Import IP blacklist. You can select multiple files. Duplicated lines will be removed.
Whitelisting support the same patterns as blacklists. If a name matches a whitelist entry, the corresponding session will bypass its names and IP filters.
Import a domain list. You can select multiple files. Duplicated lines will be removed.
Lists of sources expire after an amount of hours set in \"Refresh Delay\".
Expiry for relay lists after an amount of hours set in \"Refresh-Delay\".
The preference does not exist in dnscrypt-proxy.toml!
Immediately respond to A and AAAA queries for hostnames without a domain name.
Immediately respond to queries for local zones instead of leaking them to upstream resolvers (causing errors or timeouts).
Immediately send empty response to IPv6-related queries. Faster when there is no IPv6 connectivity, but can cause reliability issues with some stub resolvers.
Please turn off \"Private DNS\" in the Android network settings. The option interferes with InviZible.
Please turn off proxy in the Android Wi-Fi network settings. The option interferes with InviZible.
Please turn off proxy in the Android Mobile network APN settings. The option interferes with InviZible.
Too many rules to display. Only the first 1000 are shown.
When Tor needs to assign a virtual (unused) address because of a MAPADDRESS command from the controller or the AutomapHostsOnResolve feature, Tor picks an unassigned address from this range.
Try to use built-in crypto hardware acceleration when available.
Try to write to internal storage less frequently.
Governs Tor’s use of padding to defend against some forms of traffic analysis. Turn off to save bandwidth.
Makes Tor not hold OR-connections open for very long, and sends less padding on these connections. (Saves bandwidth.)
A list of country codes to never use when picking an exit node (those delivering traffic for you outside the Tor network).
A list of country codes to pick exit nodes from (those delivering traffic for you outside the Tor network).
A list of country codes to avoid when building a circuit.
A list of country codes to pick nodes from for the first hop in your normal circuits.
Turn off \"Tor bridges\" if you want to select entry nodes yourself.
Adheres to \"Exclude Nodes\" for all generated Tor circuits, even if it breaks functionality.
Makes Tor create only outgoing connections to ORs running on ports that your firewall allows (defaults to 80 and 443).
Considers builing a new circuit every set amount of seconds.
Reusable circuits first used at most the set amount of seconds ago, but never attach a new stream to a too old circuit.
Makes Tor not put two servers whose IP addresses are "too close" (in the same /16 range) on the same circuit.
Open this port to listen for connections from SOCKS-speaking apps.
Open this port to listen for proxy connections using the \"HTTP CONNECT\" protocol instead of SOCKS.
Open this port to listen for transparent proxy-connections.
Open this port to listen for UDP DNS-requests, and resolve them anonymously.
Allows connecting to Tor directory servers and entry nodes over IPv4.
Allows connecting to Tor directory servers or entry nodes over IPv6.
The preference does not exist in tor.conf!
Route all Tor OR-connections through the SOCKS5 proxy.
Don\'t share circuits with streams targeting a different destination address.
Don\'t share circuits with streams targeting a different destination port.
Port to listen on for incoming connections.
Router external IP for incoming connections.
The routing will not accept transit tunnels, closing down transit traffic completely.
Max. % of bandwidth limit for transit. 0–100.
Specify proxy server for NTCP. Should be http://address:port or socks://address:port.
Override maximum number of transit tunnels. 2500 by default.
Limit of open file descriptors (\"0\" uses the system limit).
Maximum size of corefile in Kb (\"0\" uses the system limit).
Address-book subscription URL for initial setup.
The preference does not exist in i2pd.conf!
DNSCrypt was killed by Android. Your connection to the Internet was restored. Check the device settings.
Tor was killed by Android. Your connection to the Internet was restored. Check the device settings.
I2P was killed by Android. Check the device settings.
Could not connect to the Internet. Please Check the firewall rules. Allow connections for InviZible Pro and your rooting app(s).
Tor can\'t connect to the Internet. Your ISP may be blocking Tor connections. Try to use \"Tor Bridges\" from Menu → Fast Settings → Bridges
Please enter a password if you want to lock the app.
Please find the recently saved InvizibleLogs.txt in the following folder and send it to the developer:
New versions of some InviZible modules are available. Install now and overwrite your module settings?
Please restart InviZible Pro and allow complete the installation. Reconfigure HOTSPOT afterwards if you use it.

\tInviZible Pro does not collect or share any personal or sensitive user data. InviZible Pro forwards internet traffic to Tor, DNSCrypt, and I2P. For detailed info, please visit the official pages of the aforementioned projects.

\tInviZible Pro is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.\n\t InviZible Pro is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.\n\t You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with InviZible Pro. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses
Download and install the new version of InviZible Pro in the background?
Download and install the new version of DNSCrypt in the background?
Download and install the new version of Tor in the background?
Download and install the new version of Purple I2P in the background?
Please wait while looking for new versions.
The update server is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.
You have activated 3 copies of InviZible with this code already. If it is wrong, please contact the developer.
Your Pro code is wrong. Please contact the developer.
You checked for new versions of InviZible Pro more than 5 times in a day. Please try again later.
This is unofficial version of InviZible. It was not built by the developer.
The InviZible Project needs your help. Please visit the donate page or enter your received premium code.
The InviZible Pro Project and its author appreciates all help. Would you like to download and upgrade to Pro? The update will continue in the background.
The InviZible Project and its author thanks you for your assistance.
Please make use of a proxy server in the settings of the connected device. Default IP 10.1.10.1 at port 8118.
Access I2P websites with Purple I2P
InviZible Pro cannot start %s! Please check the %s settings or try to force-close the app. If this does not help, please reboot your device.
Invalid custom server setup. Please check the \"SDNS\" field.
Please note that you have a pending purchase:
The InviZible project needs your help. Press \"OK\" to purchase premium features.
It is impossible to confirm your purchase. You will receive a refund in three days.
Unfortunately, this feature is only available for buyers of the premium version.

Thanks for choosing InviZible Pro. I hope it will be useful for your privacy-respecting and comfortable use of the Internet. 

	InviZible Pro includes Tor, DNSCrypt, and Purple I2P as modules. 

	InviZible Pro can use root, if your device has root privileges, or a local VPN; to deliver Internet traffic to Tor, DNSCrypt and I2P networks. 

	Privacy Policy: 
	InviZible Pro does not collect or share any personal or sensitive user data. 

	Copyright © 2019–2021 
	Garmatin Oleksandr 
	invizible.soft@gmail.com 
	invizible.net/en/privacy
Save changes? It can break InviZible Pro.
A crash report has been made. Send it to the developer to make InviZible better?
This field can be left blank
List of apps to open directly. These apps will not use Tor or a proxy to connect to the Internet!
Please select at least a proxy owner app, if you are using a local proxy.
Man-in-the-middle attack detected! Another device on the local network could be intercepting your data. Turn off, wait a few seconds, and turn on Wi-Fi. Using the current Wi-Fi hotspot may be unsafe!
ARP-spoofing detection is not supported on your device!
Potential DNS-rebinding attack detected! The %s website has been blocked.
At least start DNSCrypt and/or Tor to turn on the firewall.
Allow connections to local network, .onion-, and I2P websites
Internet connections for newly installed apps are allowed.
Internet connections for newly installed apps are blocked.
Ensure you only have 3 tiles or fewer in \"Quick Settings\". Adding more can cause issues with app control.
